intro: Lasiosiphon anthylloides var. macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant has elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often larger than those of the typical variety. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a notable species in its native habitat.
